event_context.name: Stockholm 2025 Ecumenical Jubilee
event_context.significance: Modern ecumenical movement foundation; Söderblom Nobel Peace legacy

church-of-sweden.ecclesiology: Episcopal-synodical with democratic governance; national church model with elected bishops
church-of-sweden.soteriology: Lutheran justification by faith alone (sola fide), grace alone (sola gratia), scripture alone authority
church-of-sweden.sacramental_theology: Two sacraments (Baptism, Eucharist); episcopal confirmation; broad inclusivity including LGBTQ+ ordination
church-of-sweden.social_ethics: Progressive activism: climate leadership, peace advocacy, refugee support, LGBTQ+ inclusion, creation care priority
church-of-sweden.ecumenical_theology: Full WCC engagement, Porvoo Communion with Anglicans, ecumenical leadership heritage from Söderblom
church-of-sweden.swedish_context: Church-state separation (2000), ~3.3M members, cultural establishment role, declining but significant influence

swedish-pentecostal.ecclesiology: Congregational autonomy with cooperative fellowship; democratic local governance, elected leadership
swedish-pentecostal.soteriology: Four-fold Gospel: Jesus as Savior, Sanctifier, Healer, Coming King; personal conversion and sanctification emphasis
swedish-pentecostal.sacramental_theology: Two ordinances (believer's baptism by immersion, communion); baptism in Holy Spirit with initial evidence of tongues
swedish-pentecostal.social_ethics: Holistic gospel combining evangelism with social action; PMU development work, addiction recovery, immigrant integration
swedish-pentecostal.ecumenical_theology: Selective evangelical cooperation; growing openness to broader Christian dialogue while maintaining distinctives
swedish-pentecostal.swedish_context: Revival origins (early 1900s), fully integrated Swedish identity, ~84K members, strong youth engagement, contemporary worship

roman-catholic.ecclesiology: Papal primacy and infallibility, episcopal hierarchy, magisterial authority, universal church unity under Pope
roman-catholic.soteriology: Grace through faith and works cooperation, sacramental mediation, purgatory doctrine, merit and satisfaction theology
roman-catholic.sacramental_theology: Seven sacraments with ex opere operato efficacy, Eucharistic transubstantiation, clerical celibacy in Latin rite
roman-catholic.social_ethics: Catholic Social Teaching: preferential option for poor, subsidiarity, solidarity, creation care (Laudato Si'), just war theory
roman-catholic.ecumenical_theology: Vatican II ecumenical commitment, bilateral theological dialogues, unity through visible communion under papal primacy
roman-catholic.swedish_context: See swedish-catholic entry for local adaptation; global Catholic perspective through Vatican representatives

ecumenical-patriarchate.ecclesiology: Conciliar authority, episcopal collegiality, autocephalous churches, Ecumenical Patriarch as 'first among equals'
ecumenical-patriarchate.soteriology: Theosis (deification) as salvation goal, synergy of divine grace and human cooperation, mystical union emphasis
ecumenical-patriarchate.sacramental_theology: Seven mysteries (sacraments), real presence in Eucharist, chrismation, married priesthood allowed, epiclesis emphasis
ecumenical-patriarchate.social_ethics: Orthodox creation theology, 'Green Patriarch' environmental leadership, peace advocacy, traditional moral teaching
ecumenical-patriarchate.ecumenical_theology: Orthodox theological dialogues with Catholics and Protestants, unity through shared apostolic succession and Orthodox faith
ecumenical-patriarchate.swedish_context: Patriarch Bartholomew as honored guest, represents global Orthodoxy to small Swedish Orthodox communities (~95K total)

theological_convergence_queries: Which traditions emphasize creation care/environmental theology?
How do episcopal vs congregational governance models compare?
What are the different approaches to sacramental theology?
Where do peace theologies align across denominations?
